conclusion: Determine the propagation time of monochromatic light in the water polo.
The inner diameter of the water polo is R and the outer diameter is 8R/3. The angle of incidence i is 30 degrees.
Calculate the path length in the water polo from point A to point B.
Snell's Law relates the angles of incidence and refraction: n1 sin(i) = n2 sin(r).
Calculate the refracted angle using Snell's Law.
Determine the effective path length L inside the water polo.
The speed of light in water is v = c/n2.
Calculate the propagation time t using t = L/v.
Calculate the path length AB using the formula for chord length: AB = 2R sin(i).
Given i = 30 degrees, sin(30 degrees) = 1/2, thus AB = R.
Using Snell's Law: 1 * sin(30 degrees) = 1.33 * sin(r), find sin(r) = 0.376.
Calculate r as sin^(-1)(0.376) approximately 22.1 degrees.
The effective path length L is the same as AB since the light travels directly through the center.
Calculate the speed of light in water: v = c/1.33.
Calculate the propagation time: t = R/(c/1.33) = 1.33R/c.
The propagation time of monochromatic light in the water polo is 1.33R/c.
